edu.harvard.cs262.DistributedGame.BattleshipGame

Class BattleshipState

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.harvard.cs262.DistributedGame.BattleshipGame.BattleshipState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameState, java.io.Serializable

    public class BattleshipState
extends java.lang.Object
implements GameState
    The BattleshipState class represents the state of the Battleship game. It encompasses all information needed to run the game, including the board of where shots were fired, the location of the ships, the current frame, and the number of hits and misses.
    Version:
    1.0, April 2014
    Author:
    Twitch Plays Battleship Group
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • BattleshipState

        public BattleshipState(int[][] shotsBoard,
               ShipLocation[] shipLocations,
               long frameCount)
        Constructor for the BattleshipState class. Sets the state's shots board, ship locations, and frame to the passed-in arguments and initializes the number of hits and misses to 0.
        Parameters:
        shotsBoard - A 2-D int array that represents where shots were fired on the board
        shipLocations - An array of ShipLocation objects that represents the lcoations of all the ships on the board
        frameCount - A long that represents the frame number of the state

    • Method Detail

      • getShotsBoard

        public int[][] getShotsBoard()
        Gets the matrix that represents what parts of the board were shot at
        Returns:
        A 2-D array of ints that holds whether that space on the board was untouched, a hit, or a miss

      • getShipLocations

        public ShipLocation[] getShipLocations()
        Gets the array that represents where all the ships are located
        Returns:
        An array of ShipLocation objects that represents the location of all ships on the board

      • getFrame

        public long getFrame()
        Gets the current frame of the state
        Specified by:
        getFrame in interface GameState
        Returns:
        A long that represents the frame of the state

      • addHit

        public boolean addHit()
        Increments the counter that represents the number of hits
        Returns:
        A boolean that is always true and shows that the hit counter was successfully incremented

      • addMiss

        public boolean addMiss()
        Increments the counter that represents the number of misses
        Returns:
        A boolean that is always true and shows that the miss counter was successfully incremented

      • setFrame

        public boolean setFrame(long f)
        Sets the frame of the state of the game. If the frame to be set is less than the current frame, the request is ignored.
        Parameters:
        f - A long that represents the frame of the game to set the state's frame to
        Returns:
        A boolean that is true if the frame is successfully set to the passed-in frame and is false if the argument frame is less than the current frame

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Prints the frame number, number of hits, and number of misses of the state
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string that includes frame, number of hits, and number of misses
